Title: Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) Declares Quarterly Dividend of $1.30
Author: MarketBeat
Extract: Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) has declared a quarterly dividend of $1.30 per share, payable March 10, 2026, to shareholders of record on February 24, 2026. This dividend, which represents an annualized $5.20 and a yield of approximately 2.5%, marks the 64th consecutive year of dividend increases for the company. Analysts predict Johnson & Johnson's earnings will sufficiently cover the dividend, with a projected future payout ratio of 47.0%.. Sentiment: Neutral (0.08). Tickers: JNJ: Somewhat-Bullish (0.31), PFE: Neutral (-0.11), WBA: Neutral (-0.14), UNH: Neutral (0.10)

Title: Pfizer Inc.: From Pandemic Icon to Platform Powerhouse
Author: AD HOC NEWS
Extract: Pfizer is transforming itself from a pandemic-era vaccine giant into a diversified biopharma platform, focusing on mRNA technology, oncology with the Seagen acquisition, and immunology & rare diseases. The company aims to leverage its scale and execute new product launches to drive growth, demonstrating to investors that it can build a sustainable innovation engine beyond its COVID-19 windfall. This strategy is crucial for its stock valuation, which reflects investor skepticism about its post-pandemic reinvention amid declining COVID revenues and patent expirations.. Sentiment: Neutral (0.09). Tickers: PFE: Somewhat-Bullish (0.17), MRNA: Somewhat-Bullish (0.32), JNJ: Neutral (0.14), BMY: Neutral (-0.15), MRK: Neutral (-0.13)

Title: AbbVie stock ends 2025 lower as markets shut for New Year — what ABBV investors watch next
Author: ts2.tech
Extract: AbbVie stock closed 2025 down by 0.5% at $228.49 on Wednesday, as U.S. markets shut for the New Year's Day holiday. Investors are now looking ahead to the Federal Reserve's late-January meeting and AbbVie's mid-January dividend record date, with attention on whether the stock can hold above its 50-day moving average and reach its 52-week high in the post-Humira transition period. The drugmaker is focusing on newer immunology medicines like Skyrizi and Rinvoq to offset the decline of Humira.. Sentiment: Neutral (-0.14). Title: Pfizer stock in focus on New Year’s Day after report of 2026 U.S. drug price hikes
Author: ts2.tech
Extract: Pfizer's stock is under scrutiny after a report indicated the company plans to raise U.S. list prices on approximately 80 medicines in 2026, including a 15% hike for its COVID vaccine Comirnaty. Investors are monitoring for potential policy pushback, especially since January is a key period for annual drug pricing adjustments. The company states its average list-price adjustments are below inflation and are necessary for research and operational costs, while other drugmakers are also adjusting prices, some even cutting them due to government negotiations.. Sentiment: Neutral (0.05). Tickers: PFE: Somewhat-Bearish (-0.25), LLY: Somewhat-Bullish (0.22), JNJ: Neutral (0.14)

Title: Corcept Therapeutics (CORT) stock sinks after FDA rebuff; relacorilant outlook resets
Author: ts2.tech
Extract: Corcept Therapeutics (CORT) stock plummeted by 50% after the FDA requested more evidence for its relacorilant drug for Cushing’s-related hypertension, leading analysts to cut price targets. While the drug's outlook for hypertension is dim, the FDA has set a July 11, 2026 deadline for relacorilant's review in platinum-resistant ovarian cancer. Investors are now awaiting clarity on potential new trials and the company's next scheduled update in late February.. Sentiment: Somewhat-Bearish (-0.25). Tickers: CORT: Bearish (-0.81), PFE: Neutral (-0.12), MRNA: Neutral (-0.13), BIIB: Neutral (-0.12), JNJ: Neutral (-0.12)

Title: AbbVie Inc. Bets Big on Immunology and Oncology: How Its Drug Portfolio Became the Real Flagship Product
Author: AD HOC NEWS
Extract: AbbVie Inc. has strategically pivoted its focus to a diversified portfolio in immunology, oncology, and neuroscience, rather than relying on a single blockbuster drug. By introducing successors to Humira like Skyrizi and Rinvoq, alongside key oncology drugs and the Allergan acquisition (Botox), AbbVie has managed its post-patent-cliff transition effectively. This strategy positions its portfolio as a multi-segment technology platform, aiming to sustain long-term growth and shareholder returns amidst intense market competition.. Sentiment: Somewhat-Bullish (0.23). Tickers: ABBV: Bullish (0.45), JNJ: Neutral (0.14), PFE: Neutral (0.14), AMGN: Neutral (0.11)

The dividend is scheduled for payment on March 10, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 20, 2026. This move reflects the company's continuous funding of innovation in the biopharmaceutical industry.. Sentiment: Somewhat-Bullish (0.17). Title: J&J strikes MFN deal with Trump, reveals plan to build 2 US manufacturing sites
Author: Fierce Pharma
Extract: Johnson & Johnson has reached a most-favored-nation (MFN) drug pricing deal with the Trump administration, allowing it to offer some drugs at lower prices comparable to other developed countries through TrumpRx.gov and Medicaid, in exchange for relief from tariffs. Alongside this agreement, J&J announced plans to build new cell therapy and drug product manufacturing facilities in Pennsylvania and North Carolina, respectively, as part of its $55 billion commitment to bolster U.S. manufacturing. This deal follows similar arrangements made by other biopharma giants with the administration after Trump's call for U.S. drug prices to match those in other developed nations.. Sentiment: Somewhat-Bullish (0.20). Tickers: JNJ: Bullish (0.42), BMY: Neutral (0.14), GILD: Neutral (0.12), AMGN: Neutral (0.12), PFE: Neutral (0.13)

Title: Royalty Pharma increases quarterly dividend by 6.8% to $0.235
Author: Investing.com South Africa
Extract: Royalty Pharma (NASDAQ:RPRX) has announced a 6.8% increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.235 per Class A ordinary share, marking its sixth consecutive year of dividend raises. The dividend is set to be paid on March 10, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 20, 2026. This decision follows recent strategic acquisitions by the company, including royalty interests in Roche's Evrysdi and new cancer therapies, alongside a positive outlook from TD Cowen..
